data.title: Wired up the Red Alert special infantry death sounds
data.body: @reaperrr already wrote the trait in #5236. While writing the changelog and searching the bug tracker I noticed that this fixes many other issues already posted. This now does the YAML changes proposed in #4210 to finish it up.

data.title: Move death voices from RenderInfantry into a separate trait
data.body:
...named DeathSounds.

Note: I have some trouble moving SpawnCorpse into a separate trait as well (my attempt didn't even compile), but I consider the sounds far more important so I'm doing those first.

Infantry DeathSounds cannot be disabled with '-' on the desert shellmap since the ants' inheritance causes a bogus yaml removal crash in that case, so I had to set them to null instead.

data.title: Remove SDL 1.2 and Cg support
data.body:
We now uniformly use SDL2 >= 2.0.2 and Gl everywhere.  This is confirmed to fix #4945, #4580 and #5228, and it may also fix other issues like #2430, #5156, #5157 (these need testing).

This will allow for a bunch of future improvements such as proper scroll physics in OSX, copy/paste in text fields, #3774, #4540, etc.

data.title: Improve startup speed
data.body:
For RA:

| What | Before | After |
| --- | --- | --- |
| LoadMaps | 1393 | 819 |
| First main menu | 3408 | 2897 |
| Start a new game | 2131 | 562 |
| Back to main menu | 2992 | 1587 |
| Start a second game | 2136 | 506 |
| Back to main menu | 3035 | 1528 |

data.title: Fix TechTree prerequisite bug for buildings with a build limit.
data.body: Fixes #5153 by preventing buildings with a BuildLimit value set always being added to the buildables cache, which is then used to determine prerequisites.

data.title: sandbags/fences/walls connect to one another
data.body:
bisecting yielded #5033 as the culprit.

![screenshot from 2014-05-01 19 32 07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/2856210/57d3e6bc-d166-11e3-90f9-555273967cea.png)

Edit: this is tagged with 'ra', but it's really mod-agnostic.

data.title: Fixed the .NET version check failing
data.body: As described in #5224 installing .NET 4.5.1 is not detected although 4.5 does not add a new versioned sub-folder in the registry, but rather just an additional key http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh925568.aspx. In fact even with .NET 4.0 this is probably broken, because since that version, Microsoft distinguishes between Full and Client. http://support.microsoft.com/kb/318785 We only need client, but full is also not bad so I added both.

data.title: Performance
data.body:
Hello.
I've downloaded OpenRA, with all mods, Dune, Tiberian and Red Alert.
I play for like 5 mins, then it starts to stuttering. I enabled frame and other options (left side with colored lines bar), to track batches etc. tick_time (white) and the blue one  go way on top of my monitor, it's just like playing at 3fps :/

Can you tell me what's the problem

data.title: Make blinking effect on window when player joins?
data.body:
Usually when i host, i dont stare the game room constantly. This can cause people to wait for nothing since i am not aware of the situation.

It would be useful if the window started to blink (in the taskbar) when someone joins or sends message in the game room. But it should do that only when the window isnt active or visible.

Currently the only way to know if anyone joined my game, is to turn up the volume. But i also like listening music, so it doesnt work very well.

data.title: Unity (ubuntu) dock/menubar isn't hidden in pseudo-fullscreen mode
data.body: This is fixed by SDL2.

data.title: Enum yaml fix.
data.body: Allow multiple enum values to be parsed from yaml with the same syntax as a string[].

data.title: Fix changelog url in the packaging script.
data.body: Fixes #5225.

data.title: Changelog.md wget is case sensitive
data.body: The packaging script tries to fetch CHANGELOG.md, but it is actually Changelog.md on the wiki.

data.title: Windows .NET installation check fails to detect .NET 4.5.1
data.body:
.NET 4.5.1 is installed, and OpenRA runs fine using it.

![installer](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/2840746/243b9d24-d05b-11e3-81df-0f84c7f330dc.png)

data.title: Repaired gdi03 mission. Fixes #5210.
data.body:
I opted to lower the power consumption for SAM instead of restoring the
original power values for FACT and PROC since those two are available to
the player as well and they would behave slightly different in this
mission than in other ones.

data.title: AI build outside the map area
data.body:
Hi all, 
I just find that AI, create building outside the map area. After destroy all enemies building game was finished. 

I have a screenshoot and demo if some one need.
![zrzut ekranu 2014-04-29 o 23 29 59](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3777450/2838704/b8cba4f6-d039-11e3-95a0-97c375d3850d.png)

data.title: Fix voxel angle of TS units
data.body: The default CameraPitch is geared towards RA, TS needs a different CameraPitch to match the isometric perspective.

data.title: Tooltip text overlapping
data.body: ![tt](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1997864/2829048/063ce610-cf9e-11e3-9a59-6ed0ce5acc52.png)

data.title: RA 4tnk balance adjustments
data.body: Closes #5179

data.title: Made CrateEffect color palette customizable
data.body:
Basically a follow-up of #5185.
CrateAction can now define a custom Palette, levelup effect of GainsExperience now uses ChevronPalette.

Automatically fixes TS mod "+1 rank" anim palette.

data.title: Un-hardcoded pip/tag/group palettes
data.body:
This implements the last bigger chunk from #5182.

-Palette for decorations can now be defined under SelectionDecorations trait.
-Adds pip types Ammo and AmmoEmpty.
-LimitedAmmo PipTypes are now customizable.
-Adds art, sequences and rules entries for TS mod decorations that were missing or using a wrong palette.
-Adds PrimaryBuilding trait to TS weapon factories and helipads.

data.title: Captured buildings should give their production options
data.body: Currently, when a Soviet player captures an Allied construction yard, he can't build Allied structures. This is true for all buildings. But capturing buildings should give the player their production options.

data.title: Replay meta
data.body:
![replay-filters](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/311595/2818825/57d6df32-cee8-11e3-805f-bdcdc9eced93.png)

This should close #2152.

data.title: Fixed Cnc Production Queue Tab Numbering
data.body:
Queue numbering now changes if a queue is removed for any reason so that the queues are
always cleanly numbered from 1 to the total number of queues.  Also lowered the NextQueueName value each time a queue is removed so that the next created queue's number is the next proper number in the sequence.

data.title: Fixed missing un-l10n of C&C Requires: production tooltip
data.body: followup of #5162 as described in #5209.

data.title: Some minor tweaks
data.body: After playtesting a bit on bleed, I think these would be an improvement.

data.title: RFC: how to deal with regressions in single-player maps due to balance changes
data.body:
I noticed today that the balance changes introduced in #5132 broke TD's gdi03 mission (see #5210).

As we progress with the single-player campaigns, I believe that situations like this will occur more often. Also, as the number of sp maps increases, reviewing balancing PRs will become a huge effort.

I'd like to use this issue to discuss how we want to deal with this.

data.title: gdi03 mission is broken in bleed
data.body:
The changes in #5132 broke gdi03 in two ways:
- the power changes lead to the SAM sites being powered off
- the custom HQ definition needs updating, otherwise both it and in turn the grenadiers aren't available

data.title: Build palette tool tips show empty list of pre-reqs
data.body: Introduced with commit SHA1: 4c4f7ab31f3bcd71aa87d982c3de129ef488387d

data.title: Plane health bar overlaps support power progress bar of airfield
data.body:
When a plane lands on an airfield, its health bar overlaps with airfield's support power progress bar.
![plane_unsel](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/2812440/eacc9e08-ce57-11e3-9fa8-1aeff9d41303.png)
![plane_sel](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/2812443/ef49be0c-ce57-11e3-8a5c-ad07956cc775.png)
This doesn't happen when the plane is first built, it only occurs after it takes off once and lands back on the airfield.
